Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We are given a sample event log for two cases A1 and B2 The events for each case are sequential and similar in nature We need to group lowlevel events into highlevel process steps Looking at the events for case A1 1 Retrieve raw metal sheet Operator A 2 Scan barcode Operator A 3 Place metal sheet on table Operator A 4 Align metal sheet Robot Arm 2 5 Preheat metal sheet Heating Unit 1 6 Pick up welding tool Operator B 7 Weld corner A Operator B 8 Weld corner B Operator B 9 Measure weld integrity Quality Sensor 1 10 Apply protective coating Coating Unit 3 11 Dry coating Heating Unit 2 12 Visual check Operator C Similarly for case B2 the same sequence of events occurs

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We can observe that the process for each case is divided into several distinct phases Phase 1 Getting the raw material and preparing it for the next steps Events 15 Retrieving the raw metal sheet scanning its barcode placing it on the table aligning it and preheating it These are all preparation steps for the raw material Phase 2 Assembly welding Events 68 Picking up the welding tool and welding two corners This is the assembly step Phase 3 Quality Inspection Events 9 and 12 Measuring weld integrity and visual check However note that the visual check is at the end Also the coating and drying steps are in between Phase 4 Surface Treatment coating and drying Events 1011 Applying protective coating and drying it

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Alternatively we might break down as 1 Material Preparation Events 15 retrieval scanning placing aligning preheating 2 Assembly Events 68 picking welding tool and welding 3 Quality Inspection Intermediate Event 9 measure weld integrity 4 Surface Treatment Events 1011 apply coating and dry 5 Final Quality Inspection Event 12 visual check However note that the sample log only has one intermediate quality check weld integrity and one final visual check Alternatively we might group the two quality checks together But they are separated by the coating process It might be better to have two separate quality steps one after assembly and one at the end

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Common stages in manufacturing might be Material Preparation Assembly Quality Inspection could be multiple Finishing which could include coating and drying We can also consider the time the events in each group are close in time For example material preparation events happen within 15 seconds from 080005 to 080020 Then there is a gap until 080100 40 seconds for the next event Then the assembly events are within 15 seconds 080100 to 080120 But note the time gaps between groups are larger than within groups

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: A1 event 9 080120 A1 event 10 080130 10 seconds apart So the groups are Group 1 080005 to 080020 15 seconds Group 2 080100 to 080120 20 seconds

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Another approach sometimes in process mining we group by the main resource or by the logical flow Here we see Operator A handles the material preparation events 13 but then the aligning is done by a robot and preheating by a heating unit So the resource changes But the logical step is material preparation Similarly Operator B does the welding events 68 Then the quality sensor does the weld check event 9 So the grouping by logical step seems appropriate We can also consider that the same resource might be used for consecutive events they are likely part of the same step primary factor is the logical grouping

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Therefore it is better to have two separate quality steps Given the above I propose the following grouping HighLevel Step 1 Material Preparation Events Retrieve raw metal sheet Scan barcode Place metal sheet on table Align metal sheet Preheat metal sheet Rationale These events are all related to preparing the raw material Alternatively we might combine the two quality steps into one step called Quality Inspection but then we have non consecutive events Therefore we must have two separate steps for the two inspections we stick to five distinct steps

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: HighLevel Step 2 Assembly Events Pick up welding tool Weld corner A Weld corner B Rationale These events involve the actual construction HighLevel Step 3 Weld Inspection Events Measure weld integrity Rationale This event is a quality check specifically on the welds HighLevel Step 4 Surface Treatment Events Apply protective coating Dry coating Rationale These events involve applying a coating HighLevel Step 5 Final Inspection Events Visual check Rationale This event is a final quality check
